page.title: 06MINCE PIE HALL( Farm)
page.content: Mince Pie Hall was originally built as a temporary Manor House before the Civil War in the 11 th Century. It was used by King Charles 1 as a hunting lodge. It is now an arable farm which covers 64 acres. It is owned by Mr.C. Ward who has lived there for 20 years. He collects guns, books about local history, swords and owns a sheet displaying the names and coats of arms of people who fought in the Civil War. Mr.Ward lives alone on the farm and employs several labourers. The farm is in fact called Bank farm, but it gets its present name from the shape of its Tower which looks like a mince pie.
